DrugName: Imaging studies such as CT or MRI scans to confirm the presence of a cervical spine mass/lesion and rule out cancer
Biopsy of the mass/lesion to determine its nature, if imaging studies are inconclusive
Pain management medications like acetaminophen (Tylenol) or NSAIDs (e.g., ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin)) to manage any associated pain and discomfort
Anti-nausea medications like ondansetron (Zofran) if the patient experiences nausea or vomiting related to their condition or treatment
Corticosteroids like dexamethasone to reduce swelling and inflammation in the cervical spine region, if necessary
Neuroprotective agents such as memantine (Namenda) to protect against potential neurotoxicity from cancer treatments, if chemotherapy is planned
Medications for exercise-induced asthma such as albuterol (Ventolin), fluticasone (Flovent), or salmeterol (Serevent) for symptom management and prevention
